comments:
Whenever I start the RSE, I see the NullPointerException (below) printed to stdout. I suppose the same problem is on Windows too, but there it is not visible because no console exists.

I've been trying to start version control of some commections in the RSE (RemoteSystemsConnections project attached - I'm not sure what actions exactly I took to create this DOM).

Created an attachment (id=42002)
The DOM that provokes the exception.

My guess is that you created a filter that resides in a connection specific filter pool. This appears to cause the connector service to be persisted along with its server launcher properties. There must be a case where the loading of the DOM is creating a DOM node that cannot be imported.
If you still have the RemoteSystemsConnections project that caused this, can you zip that up and attach it to this bug?

Yes I did play with creating various filters and putting them either into the "Team" profile or into the local one.

But I never used the checkbox "create filter for this connection only" in the new filter dialog.

There's no use trying to look at this bug any more, since the DOM and persistence has considerably changed since the bug report.
Other test cases will look at creating and importing team-shared DOMs.
